page.title: 13HISTORIC MOUND ,PURLEIGH
page.content: There is an{historic}mound in{Purleigh which is covered with bushes,trees and lots of stinging nettles. It is thought to be part of a late{11th {century Motte and Bailey Castle. The owner of the land has found some {pottery dated from that period},and also some{oyster shells},which suggest that a person of some wealth lived on this site.The amount of{stinging {nettles}also suggest people lived there. {The Motte,}or mound,has{a moat}and there are the{remains of ramparts. It was an excellent site to build a wooden keep,as they would have been able to see for miles.
